intro: Scorzoneroides pyrenaica subsp. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean scorzonera, is a perennial herb native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and flowers. This subspecies is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its specific ecological requirements.
